page.title: 18Fire at Newmans
page.content: On Thursday, May 27th 1965 a fire broke out in a large furniture store in the main street in Hythe. The fire brigade were alerted by a man who rushed into a tobacconist's opposite Newman's furniture store and asked the manager to phone the emergency services. Ten's of thousands of pounds worth of damage was done when the fire swept along the length of the roof. The fire brigade with five engines and a turntable ladder had the fire under control within thirty minutes while a crowd of 500 looked on. According to one eye witness, Mr. Raymond Fittall, "The roof exploded into flames." The store manager, Mr. Ron Weaver, lost his flat on the first floor of the building.
